intro: Acridocarpus plagiopterus, commonly known as the broad-leafed acridocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. It is often found in moist, tropical environments and can grow up to several meters in height. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
